pinyin: cún gēn gài · bù gǎi lǎo huǒ guō
english: Cungen Gai Old Style Hot Pot

etymology.description: 存根(存根) (cún gēn, "retain the base"); 蓋(蓋) (gài, "cover"); 不改(不改) (bù gǎi, "do not change"); 老(老) (lǎo, "old"); 火鍋(火鍋) (huǒ guō, "hot pot")
etymology.interpretation: This phrase refers to a style or brand of hot pot that emphasizes traditional or original flavors without alteration. The word 老火鍋(火鍋) (lǎo huǒ guō, "old hot pot") suggests a classic or traditional method, while 不改(不改) (bù gǎi, "do not change") emphasizes maintaining authenticity. 存根(存根) (cún gēn, "retain the base") and 蓋(蓋) (gài, "cover") contribute to the idea of preserving original features while serving the hot pot.

examples.chinese: 存根盖·不改老火锅是一个受欢迎的传统火锅品牌(存根蓋·不改老火鍋是一个受歡迎的傳統火鍋品牌)。
examples.pinyin: Cún gēn gài · bù gǎi lǎo huǒ guō shì yīgè shòu huānyíng de chuántǒng huǒguō pǐnpái.
examples.english: Cún Gai Old Style Hot Pot is a popular traditional hot pot brand.

examples.chinese: 我和朋友去吃存根盖·不改老火锅(我和朋友去吃存根蓋·不改老火鍋)，享受经典美味(享受經典美味)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ hé péngyǒu qù chī Cún gēn gài · bù gǎi lǎo huǒ guō, xiǎngshòu jīngdiǎn měiwèi.
examples.english: My friends and I go to eat Cún Gai Old Style Hot Pot, enjoying its classic delicious taste.

examples.chinese: 存根盖·不改老火锅凭借独特风味吸引了各地食客(存根蓋·不改老火鍋憑藉獨特風味吸引了各地食客)。
examples.pinyin: Cún gēn gài · bù gǎi lǎo huǒ guō píngjiè dútè fēngwèi xīyǐn le gèdì shíkè.
examples.english: Cún Gai Old Style Hot Pot has attracted diners from all over the region with its unique flavor.
